intro: Cathcartia punicea, commonly known as the pink cathcartia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its striking pink or reddish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a reddish hue, adding to its ornamental value. Cathcartia punicea is native to parts of Asia and is cultivated for its attractive foliage and blooms.
